title: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Victoria - Rural conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Country life - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Immigrants - Australia
abstract: One family's historic connection to Newstead. Filmed as part of 'ACMI in the Regions: Stories from Mount Alexander'.
description: Maurie Gervasoni's grandfather settled in Newstead during the Victorian gold rush in the 1860's and quickly designed and built a family estate.  A love of music and dancing made the Yandoit houses a destination  for vibrant country living. The stone house and former stables presently sit as a relic, but Maurie hopes that one day the place will be restored to its former glory.
